alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:29PM EST until February 18 at 12:27PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Stark and Summit. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from rainfall including Sandy Creek in Waynesburg and numerous branches of Nimishillen Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1025 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Canton, Cuyahoga Falls, Massillon, Barberton, Green, Alliance, Tallmadge, North Canton, Louisville, Mogadore, Minerva, Hartville, Brewster, Navarre, Waynesburg, East Sparta, Wilmot, Stow and New Franklin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
